p.seg: Die Arbeiten im Departement sind hier ganz übermannend!

div.p:
You will be surprised, noble Friend, that for so long you had no letters from me, and that even your kind felicitations letter of New Year's day
Letter not found. remained unanswered until now. With every post I intended to express my thanks and also to express my best wishes for a happy year to you and yours, and yet I did not want to come with empty hands.

For the last two years it has really […] been a misfortune that one could acquire nothing zoologically significant. In part this is explained by the now reasonably numerous museums of Australia that buy up anything procurable; in part also because really not much is collected, as the travelling and whole life here is too expensive to make such collecting expeditions even approximately payable or at all lucrative. The costs of collecting in New Guinea and other new places are enormous . Meanwhile I do hope that this year will not pass without me doing something of value for you.

This time you will receive as a forerunner a small box with rare beetles, including the very rare and valuable one that Mr Macleay named after me.
Macleay initially named the beetle, without seeing specimens of both sexes, Lamprima muelleri: see W. Macleay (1886a), pp. 135-6 (issued 23 May 1885 (Anonymous (1929)). Soon afterwards, he reassigned it to a new genus as Phalacrognathus muelleri; see W. Macleay (1886b), read at the meeting of the Linnean Society of NSW on 30 September 1885 and issued 21 December 1885. With deep affection and best feelings of gratitude.
